title: What have I got?
content:
It says its Catacomb 3D; but everyone I've met says it isn't. It uses the Keen 4 engine, even its cheats. Aside from that I know nothing, please download it an tell me before someone informs me its ilegal to spread.

[url=http://www.freewebs.com/trixicentral/CATACOMB.zip]www.freewebs.com/trixicen...TACOMB.zip[/url]A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/lind.jpg[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: What have I got?
content:
Wow, that was tricky to download...

Ha, it's like an early version of Catacomb Abyss - using a cross between the Keen 4-6 loading screen and Bio Menace menu system (but with a different engine though, this game is 3D - like an EGA version of Wolf3D, just like Catacomb Abyss was.)

Where'd you get it? It looks like it might be a prerelease of Catacomb Abyss.

title: Re: What have I got?
content:
It came with my computer, which was formerly owned by a 1337 h4X0r working at the computer store. He got a lot of ilegal games by the [then devious] method of copying them off floppies the store sold. He also spent a lot of time on the internet, before it was cool, or html was even invented.A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/lind.jpg[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: What have I got?
content:
Whoaly sh#t! That is cool, it clearly uses Keen 4-6 engine, has even a paddle war variation.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img] Woah, 16-colours! This seems to be somekind of beta of Catacomb 3D.
As well, it's illegal to distribute it, I assume. The version says in the end screen that it's not for public domain or anything. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] Cool find. By the way, does the ready Catacomb 3D use Keen 4-6 engine?Eat your veggies!

title: Re: What have I got?
content: How could a 3D game use the engine of a 2D game? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-confused.gif[/img] [hr]The human brain is not user-friendly...

title: Catacomb 3d
content:
It's just [url=http://www.mobygames.com/game/catacomb-3-d]Catacomb 3-D[/url], the one that's created by John Carmack, John Romero, Tom Hall and Adrian Carmack.

Click [url=http://www.classicgaming.com/catacomb/games.htm]here[/url] for a list of all the Catacomb games.

title: Re: Catacomb 3d
content:
Ah, so now I know.

Why couldn't they have named it something more researchable?

[quote]Quote:[hr]How could a 3D game use the engine of a 2D game?[hr][/quote]

Just add a little code that makes the 2D sprites look bigger as they get closer, and maps the 2D tiles onto 3D walls.A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/lind.jpg[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: Catacomb 3d
content: Wow, that's so cool. The engine really sucks though. It's so hard to navigate through levels.-- Censorship is F**ked! --

content:
